name: Bl. John Duns Scotus
summary: John Duns Scotus was a Scottish Franciscan friar, philosopher, and theologian. Known as 'Doctor Subtilis' (the Subtle Doctor), he was one of the most important scholastic philosophers of the High Middle Ages. He defended the doctrine of the Immaculate Conception and developed a philosophical system emphasizing the primacy of will and the univocity of being. His works influenced later scholastic thought and he was beatified by Pope John Paul II in 1993.
